message.content:
cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a framework for constructing, querying and manipulating heterogeneous information networks for machine learning tasks. This involves a data model and a declarative language for constructing and querying the networks. The paper also discusses feature extraction and learning models that operate on the relational representation. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DB (Databases) as the paper deals with data modeling and querying. The other likely categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper discusses learning models and feature extraction. The paper also deals with structured inference and integration of new data, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper showcases tasks in natural language processing, which could fall under cs.CL (Computation and Language).
